oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A horse drawn vehicle of Middle, Tennessee, n.d.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A horse-drawn vehicle of the Middle Tennessee region pictured in an undated photograph. The inscription on this vehicle reads: “Starred in Paramount Picture ‘All the Way Home, Oct. 17, 1962.’” A horse-drawn vehicle is a mechanical piece of equipment pulled by one horse or by a team of horses. These vehicles typically had two or four wheels and were used to carry passengers or heavy loads. Forms part of the Kolleen Hudgins, Director of Special Events, Mayor’s Office Collection. 1 photograph.
